CatDescriptText: Miss Evelyn L. Poynter, manager, Med-Centre Drug Co., 2042 Centre Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1959, pg. A1 with question: Do you believe the state and city FEPC laws are helping Negroes to get jobs they never held before?" answer reads: "As the question relates to the general public, I would say 'No.' However, when any question arises concerning the advantages of any type of legislation involving minority groups, there are always remote favorable examples, which are by no means indicative of the true performance of the law."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Evelyn L. Poynter wearing pharmacy uniform and wristwatch, leaning on counter with folded arms in Med-Centre Drug Co., 2042 Centre Avenue
